description: portraits of two boys, each in profile from PR, and each wearing caps; boy at right has hair curing in front of his ear, with the ends of his hair at his neck curling outward; boy at left has head turned slightly toward PL, with hair at his neck curling under
medium: Pen and brown ink on laid paper
provenance: [Pietro Scarpa, Venice, until 1971; sold July 10, for 200,000 lire, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1971-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Heads of Two Boys
